descriptionSet.description: Hatim Tai is a Hindi Movie, which was released 1956 and was directed by Homi Wadia. The image shows scenes from the movie- a couple with Moghul buildings in the background can be seen and a woman dressed as an angel with multiple faces behind her.

inscription.text: Old is gold! Released in Bombay with house-full boards!!
Homi Wadia's musical silver jubilee super hit
परवर दिगारे आलम तेरा ही है सहारा... बसंत पिक्चर्स प्रस्तुत हातिम ताई गेवाकलर निर्देशक, होमी वाडिया संगीत एस. एन .त्रिपाठी
Parvar digaare aalam tera hi hai sahara Basant pictures prastut Haatin Tai Gaywakler Nirdeshak, Homi Wadia Sangeet S.N.Tripathi
Contact for all the territories except Bombay: BASANT PICTURES, Parel, Bombay-12. For Bombay, contact: K. E. KATRAK, Naaz Bldg., Bombay - 400 004.

description-en: Hatim Tai is a Hindi Movie, which was released 1956 and was directed by Homi Wadia. The image shows scenes from the movie- a couple with Moghul buildings in the background can be seen and a woman dressed as an angel with multiple faces behind her. (gs/sp)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Homi Wadia's Hatimtai (1956), his own favourite film, which became a cult classic on the B-circuit, is quite extravagant: its chorus-lines burst with pink clouds of nymph-like fairies/paris, their diaphanous wings aflutter, as this 1990 advert for Hatimtai’s re-release reminds the fans. (Rosie Thomas) (gs)
related literature: Said, Edward 1995. "Orientalism". London: Penguin Books. (gs)
related literature: Thomas, Rosie 2010. "Still Magic. An Aladdin's Cave of 1950s B-Movie Fantasy" http://www.tasveergharindia.net/cmsdesk/essay/103/index.html, last accessed 2010-11-27. (gs)
Thomas, Rosie 2010. "Still Magic. An Aladdin's Cave of 1950s B-Movie Fantasy" http://www.tasveergharindia.net/cmsdesk/essay/103/index.html, last accessed 2010-11-27.
